p: TG-DSC measurement data is used to estimate the graphene and carbon content in the LiFePO 4/graphene and LiFePO 4/carbon composites, as shown in Figure 2. The pure LiFePO 4 can be completely oxidized to Li 3Fe 2(PO 4) 3 and Fe 2O 3 under air flow, and the total weight gain is about 5.07% in theory (Belharouak et al., 2005; Bai et al., 2015). For LiFePO 4/graphene and LiFePO 4/carbon composites, in the temperature range of 400–600°C, the graphene and carbon are oxidized to CO 2 gas, so the amounts of graphene and carbon in the LiFePO 4/graphene and LiFePO 4/carbon composites are about 1.40 and 10.70%, respectively.
